meanings.definition: A smaller block within a larger block.
meanings.sent1: The toy set includes a colorful subblock that fits perfectly inside the big block.
meanings.sent2: The city is divided into several subblocks, each with its own unique characteristics.
meanings.sent3: The subblock decided to throw a party for all the other blocks in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: In the game of Tetris, the subblock can be the key to completing a full line.
meanings.sent5: The subblock stood out with its bright red color among the sea of gray blocks.

meanings.sent1: She will subblock the large project into manageable tasks for the team.
meanings.sent2: The software allows users to easily subblock the data for better organization.
meanings.sent3: He decided to subblock his time between work, family, and hobbies.
meanings.sent4: The artist will subblock the canvas into sections before starting the painting.
meanings.sent5: It is important to subblock the budget to track expenses effectively.
